page.title: 08BRANT BROUGHTON FOOD IN 1930
page.content: Some local people were interviewed about life 50 years ago.Here are some snippets about food: "The farmer's wife would make cheese and butter,which seemed to have more taste.Everybody used to keep a pig so that they had always got some meat.There was always some fat bacon.We would have the pig treated and hung.We would make all our own pork pies, sausages,brawn and anything else we could." "A favourite pudding was steam roly- poly.A piece of paste was rolled flat covered with jam and then rolled up like a swiss roll and put in a cloth bag.This was then steamed in a steamer on top of the saucepan which was cooking the potatoes.Pudding was always the first course the idea being that you got your fill with pudding and so did not eat a lot of meat."
